issues.description: The `numberOfLecturers` attribute is declared as type `byte` in the solution but is specified as `int` in the UML diagram in the problem statement. This mismatch will confuse students about which type to use and will lead to incorrect implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the declaration of `numberOfLecturers` in Lecture.java from `byte` to `int` so it matches the UML specification and problem statement.

issues.description: The constructor in the solution takes a `byte` parameter for `numberOfLecturers`, whereas the problem statement’s UML and constructor task imply an `int` parameter. Students will not be able to call the constructor with integer literals without casting.
issues.suggested_fix: Adjust the constructor signature to accept an `int numberOfLecturers` instead of `byte`.

issues.description: The setter `setNumberOfLecturers` in the solution accepts a `byte` argument, conflicting with the `int` attribute type implied by the problem statement. This will lead to a signature mismatch when students implement or call the setter.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the parameter type of `setNumberOfLecturers` to `int` so it matches the declared field type.
